com.leanplum

Class ActionArgs

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.leanplum.ActionArgs

  • public class ActionArgs
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents arguments for a message or action.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructor and Description
      ActionArgs()

    • Method Detail

      • with

        public <T> ActionArgs with(java.lang.String name,
                  T defaultValue)
        Adds a basic argument of type T.
        Type Parameters:
        T - Type of the argument. Can be Boolean, Byte, Short, Integer, Long, Float, Double, Character, String, List, or Map.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the argument.
        defaultValue - The default value of the argument.

      • withColor

        public ActionArgs withColor(java.lang.String name,
                   int defaultValue)
        Adds a color argument with an integer value.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the argument.
        defaultValue - The integer value representing the color.

      • withFile

        public ActionArgs withFile(java.lang.String name,
                  java.lang.String defaultFilename)
        Adds a file argument.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the argument.
        defaultFilename - The path of the default file value. Use null to indicate no default value.

      • withAsset

        public ActionArgs withAsset(java.lang.String name,
                   java.lang.String defaultFilename)
        Adds an asset argument. Same as withFile(java.lang.String, java.lang.String) except that the filename is relative to the assets directory.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the argument.
        defaultFilename - The path of the default file value relative to the assets directory. Use null to indicate no default value.

      • withAction

        public ActionArgs withAction(java.lang.String name,
                    java.lang.String defaultValue)
        Adds an action argument.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the argument.
        defaultValue - The default action name. Use null to indicate no action.
